column4: ok so why then does my Realtek 8185 show up when i lspci scan, but i cant get it to notice it as a network interface after i load the drivers with ndiswrapper
is that the realtek that's wireless but usb based even though it's internal?
ah...well i ran into one of those, forget the model, but lspci would show it and it wound up working with a win98 only driver
yep, had to use the 32 bit driver and os
